results.title: Clockers
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Martin Scorsese, Spike Lee and Jon Kilik
results.brief_description: An evocative and hard-hitting story of a drug run urban battlefield where Strike (Mekhi Phifer), a 24-hour drug dealer known as a ‘clocker’, finds that his time of success on the street is running out. Nursing an ulcer and spending his spare time playing with model trains and hanging around with his brothers outside the project houses, one day Strike is given a tip off by the local drug lord, Rodney, for what seems to be an opportunity for advancement. However, when a rival dealer ends up dead and his own law-abiding brother confesses to the murder he finds himself caught between two homicide detectives, only one of whom is concerned about the truth, and the wrath and cover ups of his street-wise colleagues. This film poignantly explores the complex machinations of a neighbourhood spiraling out of control where few can be credited with looking after anyone but themselves. Layered with issues of social and racial upheaval and prejudice and the evocation of the qualities and disparities of human behaviour this is another example of powerful filmmaking from director, Spike Lee.

results.title: Cloak and dagger
results.creator_credit: Milton Sperling, United States Pictures and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper is an American science professor, parachuted into war torn Nazi Germany to obtain military secrets. The deeper he probes, the deadlier his mission becomes, especially when his involvement with the mysterious Gina (Lilli Palmer) catapults him into a whirlpool of danger, betrayal and murder.

results.title: Clive eats alligators
results.creator_credit: David Ferris, Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cover to cover”.
Trevor Lunn interviews children’s writer Alison Lester about her children’s books particularly “Clive eats alligators”. She dicusses with children from South Melbourne Primary School her reasons and inspirations for writing and the choice of illustrations in her childrens’ books.

results.title: Clint Eastwood: out of the shadows
results.creator_credit: Rhapsody Films, American Masters, BBC-TV and Bruce Ricker
results.brief_description: This documentary on American actor and director Clint Eastwood traces his long career from his early appearances in B-grade films like ‘Tarantula’ (1955) and ‘Return of the Creature’ (1955) and his seven years spent playing the character of Rowdy on the long running television series ‘Rawhide’, to his iconic performances in Leone’s spaghetti westerns and the ‘Dirty Harry’ series. Extensive clips from the films he acted in and directed, are combined with interviews with Eastwood and his contemporaries including Martin Scorsese, James Garner, Janet Maslin, Sergio Leone, Curtis Hanson, William Goldman, Donald Sutherland and Meryl Streep. Influences on Eastwood’s life and career such as his enduring interest in jazz music are also explored. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhapsody Films, American Masters, BBC-TV and Bruce Ricker

results.title: Clint Eastwood
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Speak softly and carry a big gun…that’s the attitude that has made Clint Eastwood one of the biggest box office stars! And this video looks at his entire film career, from the early “Spaghetti Westerns”made in Italy to his Hollywood superstar years with “Dirty Harry” and beyond. Featured are rare film clips, original coming attractions, previews, and more, including footage never released to television. It’s a treasure trove featuring Eastwood’s best work, and the first serious retrospective of his lengthy acting career. Whether you’re an Eastwood fan, a film buff, or an action-adventure afficionado, this is a video you’ll want to watch over and over again.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description: A study of climbing plants, including such “scramblers” as the bramble and the rose; the leaf-holding clematis, the canary creeper, the root climbing ivy, etc.

results.title: Climbing plants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Botany”.
The film provides a clear explanation of every plant’s need for light and then shows the adaptations which are developed by climbing plants to fulfil this need. Time-lapse techniques are used to illustrate the twining of stems and the growth of different kinds of tendrils. Designed for class-room use.

results.title: Climbers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Silver Films, Australian Film Commission and Rosalind Gillespie
results.brief_description: A visually dramatic film which can be used to promote discussion and interest in the art of dance, dance interpretation, choreography and communication. ‘Climbers’ presents an allegory in contemporary dance of the international struggle for women’s liberation, the theme being drawn from the Japanese Women’s ascent of Mount Everest in 1975. An excellent example of contemporary dance in Australia in the 1980’s - Margaret Barr was a significant figure (as a choreographer) of this period and earlier. Film direction by Rosalind Gillespie shows original approach.
